abstract: A revamped CBS morning show is meant to emphasize hard news - a quick study of the first day shows some differences between it and its competitors.
lead_paragraph: 3:11 p.m. | Updated On Monday, CBS introduced a revamped morning show that is meant to distinguish itself from its more popular competitors - the top-rated "Today" show at NBC and ABC's "Good Morning America" - by emphasizing hard news. With the help of a TV remote control and TVEyes, here's a look at how "CBS This Morning" diverged from the others.

headline.main: CBS Begins to Redefine What's News in the Morning
